titleStmt.title: Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary" / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.title: I. Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II) (LöfUpp 100-05, no. 32);

msItem.title: I-1) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

p.span: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (al-Muˁallaqah) of Məsr (Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...

span.span: ...ሰላም፡ ለክሙ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ወዮሐንስ፡ ወእንድርያስ
ማቴዎስ፡ ወፊልጶስ፡ ወበርተሎሜዎስ፡ ቶማስ፡ ወያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ እልፍዮስ፡ ታዴዎስ፡ ወናትናኤል፡ ወማትያስ፡ ሉቃስ፡ ወማርቆስ፡ ወያዕቆብ፡ ኤጲስ፡ ቆጶስ፡ ለደቂቅክሙ፡ ባርኩነ፡ በቅዱስ፡ መንፈስ ።
Fol. 5avb l. 24: ...Salutation to you, Peter and Paul, Jacob and John, and Andrew [Fol. 6ra], Matthew and Philip, and Bartholomew, Thomas and Jacob,
, Thaddeus and Nathanael, and Matthias, Luke and Mark, and Jacob the bishop, bless us, your children, by the Holy Spirit.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II), fols. 3-7b;
BritMus Orient. 8814 (18th cent.), fols. 86ra-92v (StrBritLib 46, no. 32), fol. 82ra-92v;

div.span: A part of the introductory rite, as it was printed in Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:16, is missing in the MS (fol. 4vb). Besides, a part of the introductory exhortation (as printed in Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:9-10) was inserted between the two parts of the introductory rite (fol. 5vb, l.17-5
ra, l.27). The sälam is present only in the edition Budge 1900:4-5:
Fol. 3ra, l.1-5vb, l.17: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (1st part)
ra, l.27: Haleluya Haleluya nəsgəd läˀabä bərhanat
ra, l.27-5αvb, l.3: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (2nd part)

span.span: Fol. 5αvb, l.4-6ra, l.10: Sälam to the Apostles

msItem.title: I-1a) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

span.span: Fol. 10ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, One God. This book of rules that came from the throne of Mark the Apostle, out of the church of Mäˁalqa (i.e. Al-Mu´Allaḳah) of Məsr (i.e. Cairo) wherein the Orthodox Doctors, glorious patriarchs, treasurers of the mystery had laid it up...

p.span: Fol. 15va l.5: And for us, may they be cut off and excommunicated by the sword of our word, of abba Mikaˀel and abba Gäbrəˀel, because we have received their power, and therefore we excommunicated and bind fast, with a fetter which cannot be opened until her Son will come in glory, him, who do not honour the festival of our Lady Mary like the first Sabbath. [Fol. 15vb] For ever and ever. Amen.

div.span: The end of the text is missing. S. MS, fol. 15vb, Budge 1900:4 and Täsfa Gäbrä Śəllase 1961:20.
Fol. 13va, l.8-14ra, l.4: Haleluya Haleluya nəsgəd läˀabäbərhanat
Fol. 14ra, l.4-14rb, l.18: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (2nd part)
Fol. 14va, l.1-14vb, l.17: Sälam to the Apostles
Fol. 15ra, l.1-15vb, l.2: Mäṣḥafä śərˁat (3rd part)

msItem.title: I-2) Introductory exhortation
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

p.span: Fol. 16ra: In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, one God. We will tell you, our brothers, children of the church, may God bless you and enlighten the eyes of your hearts to hear the miracles of our Lady Mary, the holy and twofold Virgin...

p.font: for the name of the one who did not prostrate himself will be blotted out of existence,
and the memorial of his name will not be known.
And all the angels of heaven will say: "Amen".

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 11 (ca. 1660), fols. 12-14aa (LöfUpp 88, no. 30-D, "Zweite Einleitung");

msItem.title: I-3) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wäʾǝweddǝsäki "I worship Thee…"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

span.span: እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡ ወእዌድሰኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ በ፪ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለፀሐየ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ሠረገላሁ። ...
ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ክብረ፡ ወሞገሰ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ወጸልዪ፡ ኀበ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልድኪ፡ ከመ፡ ይሥረይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ።

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II) (LöfUpp 100), no. 32 I-C.;

msItem.title: I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam "Miracles of Mary"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

span.span: ጽሕፍ፡ በረድኤተ፡ ሀብቱ፡ በጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሃ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡

explicit.p: (48th Miracle) Fol. 109ra, l. 7: ወሀለዉ ፡ ውሉደ ፡ ውሉዱ፡ በሩካን፡ አግብርተ፡ እግዚእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እስከ፡ ዮም፡ ውስተ፡ ይእቲ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ ወአውረስቶ፡ ምሕረተ፡ [Fol. 209rb] ወልዳ። ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ለዓለመ፡ዓለም፡ አሜን፨

I-4)-41. Fols. 91ra-93rb: Miracle that happened in a church in Constantinople (“Rome”)
I-4)-42. Fols. 93rb-96va: About a woman who accommodated an Ethiopian priest called Clement
I-4)-43. Fols. 96va-99vb: About an old man in Bethlehem throttled by a door of the church’s double door
I-4)-44. Fols. 99vb-101vb: About a renegade Christian who saw Virgin Mary in a vision, reconverted and was killed by Muslims (otherwise not attested?).
I-4)-45. Fols. 101vb-104va: About the Emperor Constantine’ s Sister Tawdosya
I-4)-46. Fols. 104va-106vb: About the young child called Cosma (Qozmos) of Bartos (probably incomplete)
About a renegade Christian who saw Virgin Mary in a vision, reconverted and was killed by Muslims (the same as 44th Miracle, above; incomplete, the end missing).
109ra-rb: The end of a miracle (unidentified, incomplete, the beginning missing).

msItem.title: I-5) ʾAkkonu bǝʾǝsi "Does not the Man..."
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

span.span: አኮኑ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሶበ፡ ሐኒፀ፡ ቤት፡ አፍተዎ፡ ኵሎ፡ ጻዕፃዎ፡ ያቀድም፡ አስተዳልዎ። ...
ጽሒፈ፡ ውዳሴኪ፡ እሙ፡ እንዘ፡ ይፈቅዱ። ኢክሉ፡ ጥንቁቀ፡ ፈጽሞ፡ ለለ፩፩። እስመ፡ ከመ፡ ኆፃ፡ ብዙኅ፡ ኢውሱን፡ ፍቅዱ።

p.span: Fol. 77ra l.4: ...Wishing to write the praise of His mother they could not encompass (the miracles) completely, absolutely, one by one, since they are many like sand and their number is unlimited.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II) (LöfUpp 100-05, no. 32);

note.p: Each of the 33 strophes of the hymn follows a miracles of Mary, I-4) - 34). The last strophe (n°34) of the hymn is missing.

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Iyäsus "Miracles of Jesus"
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; name of the donors; groups of lines in the incipit page of Text I-4a; incipit of (sub)sections and section numbers of Text I-4a; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

span.span: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ የሁሉ
ላዕለ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ገብሩ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ወሶበ፡ በጽሐ፡ ጊዜ፡ ልደቱ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወጽአ፡ ትእዛዝ፡ እምኃበ፡ ቄሳር፡ ንጉሥ፡ ከመ፡ ይትኈለቁ፡ ኵሉ፡ ደቂቀ፡ እስራኤል፡

p.span: Fol. 6ra, l.11: When arrived the time of the birth of Our Lord and Our Savior Jesus Christ, a decree was proclaimed by the King that all children of Israel be counted in their respective country.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Ethiop. 15 (the time of Mǝnilǝk II), II.-1.;
BN éth. 321 (19th cent.), fols. 1ra-5ra (GrébGriaule I 53-54, no 17);

p.span: As the selection of miracles and the passages of the ˀAkkonu bəˀəsi

indicates, the initial intention of the scribe (or creator of the archetype) was to produce a compilation of two works: the Täˀamrä Maryam wä-Iyäsus (cp. Witakowski 1995:281, cp. Uppsala O Etiop 15). However, it was dropped already in the beginning of the work; apart from the strophes of the hymn, only 3 miracles of Jesus were included, two in the beginning and one in the end.

msItem.note: The miracles of Text I-4a are partly numbered (number 27 was given twice).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 114.0 folios, of which blank Fols. 2ra, 2v, in 17.0 quires (A+15+B).
19.3 17.0 6.5

signatures.note: - Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper corner on fols.: 28r: ፪; 36r: ፫; 44r: ፬; 52r: ፭; 60r: ፮; 67r: ፯.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been resewn. The leather cover on the back board is cut off. Leaves of quire A and III are damaged at the lower corner (rodents).

layout.note: Text area I: fols. 3r-9v (quire I). All data for fol. 4.
layout.ab: the number of lines varies up to 28 (fol. 5a)
Ruling pricks are visible (partly of slit-type, fol. 3).
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Text area II: fols. 10r-15v (quire II). All data are for fol. 11r.
layout.ab: the number of lines varies on other fols.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.

list.item: II. four dot asterisk; nine dot asterisk;
III. chain of black and red dots (dividing miracles); nine dot asterisks (e.g., fol. 29va).

handNote.ab: Hand a: mediocre. Hand b: irregular. Hand c, d, e: fine.
handNote.date: Hand a, b, c: 19th century. Hand d: 18th century (?). Hand e: 17th century (?).

list.item: ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 19rb-vb)

handDesc.handNote: Hand a: fols. 3ra-9ra (quire I, Texts I-1a, II-a), rounded script.
Hand b: fols. 10ra-15vb (quire II, Text I-1b), irregularly formed, right-sloping letters.
Hand c: fols. 16ra-19ra (quire III, Texts I-2, I-3, rounded script.
Hand d: fols. 20ra-106vb (quires IV-XIV, Text I-4a), broadly spaced, slight right-sloping letters.
Hand e: fols. 107ra-110vb (quire XV, Texts I-4b, II-b), finely shaped, slender letters.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 10r (incipit page of Text I-1b): crude ornamental band; geometric and floral motifs (in red and blue pen).

p.span: Fols. 1ra-2ra: Excerpt from Śərˁatä mənkwəsənna "The Order of the Monastic Profession".

q.p: Fol. 1ra (incipit): በአርያም፡ ዘይነጽር፡ ላዕለ፡ ትሑታን። ዘአቀመ፡ ሰማያተ፡ በጥበቡ፡ ዘአጽንዓ፡ ለምድር፡ ዲበ፡ ማይ። ...

p.span: …ወዝንቱ፡ መዊዕ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ወይቤለኒ፡ እሉ፡ ውሉድከ፡ እንጦንስ፡ እለ፡ ለብሱ፡ አስኬማ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወገብሩ፡ ትእዛዝከ፡ ወቀብዎ፡ ሎቱ፡ በፈሪሃ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘኮኑ፡ በአምሳለ፡ አርአያነ፡ ለነ።

item.p: Written on a bifolio originating from a different Ms., added to the Ms. as endleaf.

p.span: Fol. 9ra-rb: A miracle of Mary, incomplete.

item.p: The miracle is crudely written in pen.

p.span: - ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam wäladitä ˀamlak... "O my Holy Lady Mary, Two-fold Virgin, Godbearing..." (fol. 19ra-rb)

- ˀO-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl bä-kəlˀe Maryam Mariham ˀəmmu lä-ˀIyäsus Krǝstos kähali... "O my Lady, Holy Two-fold Virgin Mary, Mother of Jesus Christ, the Almighty..." (fol. 19rb-va)(cp. ChRep no. 373)

- Sälam läki ˀo-ˀәgzǝˀtǝyä qəddəst dəngəl Maryam ˀəmmä bərhan[sic] wä-ˀəmmä bərhan... "Salutation to you, o my Lady, Holy Virgin Mary, Mother [of the Saviour] and Mother of the Light..." (fol. 19va-vb).

item.p: The hymns were probably written in hand b.

p.span: …ልዑል፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ይባርከነ፡ ወይሠለነ፡ ወያርኢ፡ ገጾ፡ ላዕሌነ፡ ወንሕየው፡ እም፡ ቃለ፡ ሕጉ፡ ወእም፡ ቃለ፡ መጻሕፍቲሁ፡ ዘገደፍነ፡ ወዘወሰክነ፡ ዘአቅደምነ፡ ወዘአድኃርነ፡ ከሀኬትነ፡ ወበድካምነ፡ ከባቲ፡ አበሳ፡ ወልዱ፡...

div.span: ... ኦንጉሠ፡ ሠላም፡ ሠላማዊ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ሰላመከ፡ ሀበነ፡ አጽንዕ፡ ለነ፡ ሰላመከ፡ ወሥራይ፡ ለነ፡ ኃጣውኢነ፡ ነሑር፡ ወንዕቱ፡ በሰላም።

item.p: Written on an endleaf (probably added later).

span.span: ዝ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አሲር፡ መትራ፡ የሻለ

item.p: Partly illegible. The note states Täsfa Maryam as buyer and donater of the Ms.

p.span: Fol. 111v: Magic prayer against snake venom.

list.item: - Crude drawings: fol. 112r-v. - Pen trial: fol. 112r

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather, textile inlays. Recent overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather (fastened with nails). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover. Due to its poor condition, the tools cannot be identified. Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (2 tools were used: single line fillet, x-form).

origin.origDate: 18th cent. (?) Quires A-III and B are of more recent time (19th cent.?).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The names of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. According to Additio 5, the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church by Täsfa Maryam. His name and the name of his family members has been added to the supplication formulas in the same hand as Additio 5.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
